summary:
Moles are small, unique mammals that live mostly underground. They have strong front paws for digging and a cylindrical body shape. You can find them in North America, Europe, and Asia, belonging to the Talpidae family. Some other similar mammals, like golden moles in Africa and marsupial moles in Australia, are not closely related.

While some people consider moles a nuisance in gardens, they are beneficial to the environment. Moles improve soil quality, control slug populations, and provide food for other animals. Their diet mainly consists of earthworms and other tiny creatures living in the soil.
title: Mole (animal)
